subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 1 O Lord, I have so many enemies; so many are against me. 2 So many are saying, "God will never rescue him!" 3 But You, O Lord, are a shield around me; You are my glory, the one who holds my head high.
reflection: David was not sitting on his throne in a place of power, but he was running for his life from his rebellious son, Absalom, and a group of traitors. When circumstances go against us, it is tempting to think that God is also against us. But David reminds us that the opposite is true. When everything seems to go against us, God is still for us. So if circumstance has turned against you-don't blame God-seek Him. .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, as this life sends many trials my way, I pray that Your Holy Spirit would make me mindful that You are but a prayer away. Guide, direct, and be my shield. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 3:1-3 (NLT)

1 O Lord, I have so many enemies; so many are against me.

2 So many are saying, "God will never rescue him!" 
3 But You, O Lord, are a shield around me; You are my glory, the one who
holds my head high. 



Today's Thoughts:

David was not sitting on his throne in a place of power, but he was running
for his life

from his rebellious son, Absalom, and a group of traitors. .



When circumstances go against us, it is tempting to think that God is also
against us.

But David reminds us that the opposite is true. When everything seems to go
against 

us, God is still for us. .



So if circumstance has turned against you-don't blame God-seek Him. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, as this life sends many trials my way, I pray that

Your Holy Spirit would make me mindful that You are but a prayer away.

Guide, direct, and be my shield. Amen.



Phil. 4:8 Fix your thoughts on what is true and honorable and right.

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 5 I lay down and slept, yet I woke up in safety, for the Lord was watching over me.
reflection: Sleep does not come easily during a crises. David could have had many sleepless nights when his son Absalom rebelled and gathered together an army to kill David. But he slept peacefully, even during the rebellion. What made the difference? ? ? David cried out to the Lord-and the Lord heard him. The assurance of answered prayer bring peace. It is easier to sleep well when we have full assurance that God is in control of circumstances. If you are lying awake at night worrying about circumstances you can't change-pour out your heart to God, and thank Him that He is in control-Then sleep will come. .
prayer: Dear Lord, You know that I have often worried needlessly when You are very capable of taking care of any circumstance that comes my way. Forgive me for my little faith. Amen.

the rebellion. .

heard him.

The assurance of answered prayer bring peace. It is easier to sleep well

full assurance that God is in control of circumstances. .



If you are lying awake at night worrying about circumstances you can't

your heart to God, and thank Him that He is in control-Then sleep will come.
. .

capable

of taking care of any circumstance that comes my way. Forgive me for my
little faith. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Victory comes from You, O Lord. May Your blessings rest on Your People.
reflection: The "Great Commission" is that believers are to be witnesses telling the world who God is and what He has done. Do people know who God is through your words and example? They cannot see God directly-but they can see Him reflected in you!
prayer: Dear Lord, when I fail to be a living example for You, I pray that Your Spirit would awaken me to my negligence. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Ps. 3:8

Victory comes from You, O Lord. May Your blessings rest on Your People.



Today's Thoughts:

The "Great Commission" is that believers are to be witnesses telling the

world who God is and what He has done. .



Do people know who God is through your words and example?



They cannot see God directly-but they can see Him reflected in you!



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, when I fail to be a living example for You, I pray that Your

Spirit would awaken me to my negligence. .Amen.





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"He says, "Be still, and know that I am God;" Psalm 46:10

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: You can be sure of this: The Lord set apart the godly for himself. The Lord will answer when I call to him.
reflection: The godly are those who are faithful and devoted to God. David knew that God would hear him when he called and would answer him-We too, can be confident that God listens to our prayers And answers when we call upon HimSometimes we think that God will not hear us because we have fallen short of His high standards for holy living. BUT if we have trusted Christ for salvation, God has forgiven us, and He will listen to us. When you feel that your prayers are bouncing off the ceiling, remember as a believer you have been set apart by God and that He loves you. He hears and answers--although His answers may not be what you expected-look at your problems in light of God's power instead of looking at God in the shadow of your problems.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, in the midst of my problems strengthen my faith so that I would never doubt that You hear or answer my prayers. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Psalm 4:3 

You can be sure of this: The Lord set apart the godly for himself. 

The Lord will answer when I call to him. 



Today's Thoughts:

The godly are those who are faithful and devoted to God. David knew that God
would hear him

when he called and would answer him-We too, can be confident that God
listens to our prayers

And answers when we call upon HimSometimes we think that God will not hear us because we have fallen short of
His high standards

for holy living. BUT if we have trusted Christ for salvation, God has
forgiven us, and He will listen

to us. .



When you feel that your prayers are bouncing off the ceiling, remember as a
believer you have

been set apart by God and that He loves you. He hears and answers--although
His answers may

not be what you expected-look at your problems in light of God's power
instead of looking at

God in the shadow of your problems. 



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, in the midst of my problems strengthen my faith

so that I would never doubt that You hear or answer my prayers. Amen.





Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Phil. 4:8 Fix your thoughts on what is true and honorable and right.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Offer sacrifices in the right spirit, and trust the Lord. 6 Many people say, "Who will show us better times?" Let your face smile on us, Lord.
reflection: As we know worship in David's day included animal sacrifices by the priests in the Tabernacle. The animal's blood covered the sins of the one who offered the animals. There were specific rules for offering sacrifices, but more important to God than ceremony was the attitude or submission and obedience-as we see in (I Samuel 15:22, 23). Today a "proper sacrifice, " one that is pleasing to God, is still the same, He wants our obedience and our praise before our gifts as seen in-(Hebrews 13:15). SO let us remember to offer God our sacrifice of total obedience and heartfelt praise. .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would be sensitive to Your Spirit's guidance so that I would be submissive to Your will and that my praises would be pleasing To You, I pray this in the name of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 4:5-6 (NLT)

Offer sacrifices in the right spirit, and trust the Lord. 
6 Many people say, "Who will show us better times?" 

Let your face smile on us, Lord. 



Today's Thoughts:

As we know worship in David's day included animal sacrifices by the priests
in the Tabernacle.

The animal's blood covered the sins of the one who offered the animals.
There were specific 

rules for offering sacrifices, but more important to God than ceremony was
the attitude or

submission and obedience-as we see in (I Sam. 15:22, 23). .



Today a "proper sacrifice," one that is pleasing to God, is still the same,
He wants our obedience

and our praise before our gifts as seen in-(Heb. 13:15). .



SO let us remember to offer God our sacrifice of total obedience and
heartfelt praise. 



Today's Prayer suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would be sensitive to Your Spirit's
guidance

so that I would be submissive to Your will and that my praises would be
pleasing

To You, I pray this in the name of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ. .
Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Worship the LORD with gladness; 
come before him with joyful songs. Psalm 100:2

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 7 You have given me greater joy than those who have abundant harvests of grain and new wine 8 In peace I will lie down and sleep, for you alone, O Lord, will keep me safe.
reflection: Two kinds of joy are contrasted here-inward joy that come from knowing and trusting Godand happiness that comes as a result of pleasant circumstances. Inward joy is steady as long as we trust God, happiness is unpredictable. Inward joy defeats discouragement; happiness covers it up-Inward joy is lasting; happiness is temporary. The choice is yours-neither is forced upon us. .
prayer: Dear Lord my choice is simple I choose knowing and trusting You so that I may have the inward lasting Joy that comes from You. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Psalm 4:7-8 (NLT)

7 You have given me greater joy than those who have abundant harvests of
grain and new wine

8 In peace I will lie down and sleep, for you alone, O Lord, will keep me
safe. 



Today's Thoughts:

Two kinds of joy are contrasted here-inward joy that come from knowing and
trusting Godand happiness that comes as a result of pleasant circumstances. .



Inward joy is steady as long as we trust God, happiness is unpredictable.
Inward joy defeats

discouragement; happiness covers it up-Inward joy is lasting; happiness is
temporary. .



The choice is yours-neither is forced upon us. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord my choice is simple I choose knowing and trusting You so that

I may have the inward lasting Joy that comes from You. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 5 Therefore, the proud may not stand in your presence, for you hate all who do evil. 6 You will destroy those who tell lies. The Lord detests murderers and deceivers. 7 Because of your unfailing love, I can enter your house; I will worship at your Temple with deepest awe. 8 Lead me in the right path, O Lord, or my enemies will conquer me. Make your way plain for me to follow.
reflection: God cannot condone or even excuse the smallest sin-SO we cannot excuse ourselves for sinning only A little bit-as we grow spiritually, our sensitivity to sin will also increase. What is your reaction to sin in your life? Are you insensitive-unconcerned-disappointed-or comfortable? As God makes us aware of sin-we must be intolerant toward it and be willing to change. All believers should strive to be more tolerant of people-BUT-less tolerant of the sins in others and themselves. .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to recognize my own sins as easily as I see the sins of others. Lead me in the right path-make Your way plain to me. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 5:5-8 (NLT)

5 Therefore, the proud may not stand in your presence, for you hate all who
do evil.

6 You will destroy those who tell lies. The Lord detests murderers and
deceivers. 
7 Because of your unfailing love, I can enter your house; I will worship at
your Temple with deepest awe.

8 Lead me in the right path, O Lord, or my enemies will conquer me. Make
your way plain for me to follow. 



Today's Thoughts:

God cannot condone or even excuse the smallest sin-SO we cannot excuse
ourselves for sinning only

A little bit-as we grow spiritually, our sensitivity to sin will also
increase. .



What is your reaction to sin in your life?

Are you insensitive-unconcerned-disappointed-or comfortable?



As God makes us aware of sin-we must be intolerant toward it and be willing
to change.

All believers should strive to be more tolerant of people-BUT-less tolerant
of the sins in 

others and themselves. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me to recognize my own sins as easily as I see
the sins of others.

Lead me in the right path-make Your way plain to me. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 1 O Lord, don't rebuke me in your anger or discipline me in your rage. 2 Have compassion on me, Lord, for I am weak. Heal me, Lord, for my bones are in agony. 3 I am sick at heart. How long, O Lord, until you restore me?
reflection: David accepted God's punishment-but he begged God not to discipline him in anger. Jeremiah also asked God to correct him gently and not in anger (Jeremiah 10:24). David recognized that if God treated him with justice alone and not with mercy, he would be wiped out by God's wrath. Often we want God to show mercy to us and justice to everyone else. BUT-God in His kindness forgives us instead of giving us what we deserve.
prayer: Dear Lord, it is only by Your grace and mercy that I can come before You seeking Your divine forgiveness. So I beg of You forgive my sins of thoughtword-and deed. Bless all my E-mail friends with safety and good health. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 6:1-3 (NLT)

1 O Lord, don't rebuke me in your anger or discipline me in your rage.

2 Have compassion on me, Lord, for I am weak. Heal me, Lord, for my bones
are in agony.

3 I am sick at heart. How long, O Lord, until you restore me? 



Today's Thoughts:

David accepted God's punishment-but he begged God not to discipline him in
anger.

Jeremiah also asked God to correct him gently and not in anger (Jer. 10:24).
. .



David recognized that if God treated him with justice alone and not with
mercy, he

would be wiped out by God's wrath.



Often we want God to show mercy to us and justice to everyone else.

BUT-God in His kindness forgives us instead of giving us what we deserve.



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, it is only by Your grace and mercy that I can come before You

seeking Your divine forgiveness. So I beg of You forgive my sins of thoughtword-and deed. Bless all my E-mail friends with safety and good health. .
Amen.



Pastor AL & Marcie Sather



I Cor. 3:20 The Lord knows the thoughts of the wise, that they are
worthless.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I am worn out from sobbing. All night I flood my bed with weeping, drenching it with my tears. 7 My vision is blurred by grief; my eyes are worn out because of all my enemies. 8 Go away, all you who do evil, for the Lord has heard my weeping. 9 The Lord has heard my plea; the Lord will answer my prayer. 10 May all my enemies be disgraced and terrified. May they suddenly turn back in shame.
reflection: Pouring out his heart with tears, David was completely honest with GodWe can be honest with God even when we are filled with anger or despair because God knows us thoroughly and wants the very best for us. Anger may result in rash outward acts or turning inward in depression. BUT if we trust in our all-powerful God-we don't have to be victims of circumstances or be weighed down by the guilt of sin. Be honest with God-and He will help you turn your attention from yourself to Him and His mercy. .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me of my sins so that I may not be weighed down with guilt. Help me see to turn my attention on You and realize Your grace and mercy. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 6:6-10 (NLT)

I am worn out from sobbing. All night I flood my bed with weeping,
drenching it with my tears.

7 My vision is blurred by grief; my eyes are worn out because of all my
enemies. 
8 Go away, all you who do evil, for the Lord has heard my weeping.

9 The Lord has heard my plea; the Lord will answer my prayer.

10 May all my enemies be disgraced and terrified. May they suddenly turn
back in shame. 



Today's Thoughts:

Pouring out his heart with tears, David was completely honest with GodWe can be honest with God even when we are filled with anger or despair

because God knows us thoroughly and wants the very best for us.

Anger may result in rash outward acts or turning inward in depression.



BUT if we trust in our all-powerful God-we don't have to be victims of

circumstances or be weighed down by the guilt of sin. .



Be honest with God-and He will help you turn your attention from yourself

to Him and His mercy. 



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me of my sins so that I may not be

weighed down with guilt. Help me see to turn my attention on

You and realize Your grace and mercy. Amen.



Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Phil. 4:8 Fix your thoughts on what is true and honorable and right.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 1 I come to you for protection, O Lord my God. Save me from my persecutors-rescue me! 2 If You don't, they will maul me like a lion, tearing me to pieces with no one to rescue me. 3 O Lord my God, if I have done wrong or am guilty of injustice, 4 If I have betrayed a friend or plundered my enemy without cause, 5 Then let my enemies capture me. Let them trample me into the ground and drag my honor in the dust. 6 Arise, O Lord, in anger! Stand up against the fury of my enemies! Wake up, my God, and bring justice!
reflection: Have you ever been falsely accused or so badly hurt that you wanted revenge? David wrote this Psalm in response to the slanderous accusations of those who claimed he was trying to kill Saul and seize the throne (I Samuel 24:9-11). Instead of taking things into his own hands and striking back, David cried out to God for justice. The proper response to slander is prayer, not revenge-because God says: "I will take revenge-I will repay those who deserve it" (Romans 12:19; Hebrews 10:30) Instead of striking back ask God to take your case-to bring justice-and restore your reputation. .
prayer: Dear Lord, help me bridle my tongue and instill in me pure thoughts when something slanderous has been said about me. Help me to have a Christ-like attitude. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 7:1-6 (NLT)

1 I come to you for protection, O Lord my God. Save me from my
persecutors-rescue me!

2 If You don't, they will maul me like a lion, tearing me to pieces with no
one to rescue me.

3 O Lord my God, if I have done wrong or am guilty of injustice,

4 If I have betrayed a friend or plundered my enemy without cause,

5 Then let my enemies capture me. Let them trample me into the ground and
drag my honor in the dust. 
6 Arise, O Lord, in anger! Stand up against the fury of my enemies! Wake up,
my God, and bring justice! 



Today's Thoughts:

Have you ever been falsely accused or so badly hurt that you wanted revenge?

David wrote this Psalm in response to the slanderous accusations of those
who

claimed he was trying to kill Saul and seize the throne (I Sam. 24:9-11). 



Instead of taking things into his own hands and striking back, David cried
out to

God for justice. The proper response to slander is prayer, not
revenge-because

God says: "I will take revenge-I will repay those who deserve it" (Ro.
12:19; Heb. 10:30)



Instead of striking back ask God to take your case-to bring justice-and
restore your reputation. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, help me bridle my tongue and instil in me pure thoughts

when something slanderous has been said about me. Help me to have

a Christ-like attitude. Amen.



Pastor Al & Marcie Sather



"Fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom." Pro. 1:7

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: End the evil of those who are wicked, and defend the righteous. For you look deep within the mind and heart, O righteous God.
reflection: OH YES! God looks "deep within in the mind and heart. " Nothing is hidden from GodNow this can either be terrifying or comforting. Our thoughts are an open book to God. OH YES! Let us also remember that He also knows our motives-we have no place to hideNo way we can pretend to get away with sin-BUT that knowledge can also give us comfort. We don't have to impress God or put up a false front. Instead-we can trust God to help us work through our weaknesses in order to serve Him as He has planned-when we truly follow God, He rewards our efforts. .
prayer: Thank You Lord, for Your Love and faithfulness. My request today is that You Will help me avoid my weaknesses so that I may serve You according to Your plan. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 7:9 (NLT) 

End the evil of those who are wicked, and defend the righteous. 

For you look deep within the mind and heart, O righteous God. 



Today's Thoughts:

OH YES! God looks "deep within in the mind and heart." Nothing is hidden
from GodNow this can either be terrifying or comforting. Our thoughts are an open
book to God.



OH YES! Let us also remember that He also knows our motives-we have no
place to hideNo way we can pretend to get away with sin-BUT that knowledge can also give
us comfort.

We don't have to impress God or put up a false front.



Instead-we can trust God to help us work through our weaknesses in order to
serve Him

as He has planned-when we truly follow God, He rewards our efforts. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Thank You Lord, for Your Love and faithfulness. My request today is that You

Will help me avoid my weaknesses so that I may serve You according to Your
plan. Amen.





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"Shout for joy to the LORD, all the earth." Palsm 100-_1

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I will thank the Lord because he is just; I will sing praise to the name of the Lord Most High. (Psalm 7:17)
reflection: During times of great evil and injustice, David was grateful that God is just and faithfulWhen we wonder if anyone is honest and fair, we can be assured that God will continue to bring justice and fairness when we involve Him in our activitiesIf you ever feel that you are being treat unfairly, ask the One who is always fair and just to be with you. Then thank Him for His presence
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You, that You are fair and just and that You are a loving and forgiving God. I thank You for being close at hand and are just a prayer away. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Psalm 7:17 (NLT)

I will thank the Lord because he is just; I will sing praise to the name of
the Lord Most High. 



Today's Thoughts

During times of great evil and injustice, David was grateful that God is
just and faithfulWhen we wonder if anyone is honest and fair, we can be assured that God will
continue

to bring justice and fairness when we involve Him in our activitiesIf you ever feel that you are being treat unfairly, ask the One who is
always fair and just

to be with you. Then thank Him for His presence. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

You are a loving and forgiving God. I thank You for being close at hand

and are just a prayer away. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"Shout for joy to the LORD, all the earth." Palsm 100-:1

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 14 The wicked conceive evil; they are pregnant with trouble and give birth to lies. 15 They dig a deep pit to trap others, then fall into it themselves. 16 The trouble they make for others backfires on them. The violence they plan falls on their own heads.
reflection: When allowed to run its course, evil often destroys itself. Violent people become victims of violence and liars become victims of others' deceit. BUT in the process innocent people are hurtSometimes God intervenes and stops evil doers in their tracks in order to protect His followers-At other times, for reasons known only to Him, God allows evil to continue even though innocent people are hurt. It is during these times that we must ask God to protect us-Remember God will execute final justice although it may not be during our lifetime. .
prayer: Dear Lord, we are living in sinful times, drugs and violence of every kind are prevalent and our young people are in the midst of it all, protect Your followers from this evil that plagues our country. Amen
original_content:

to lies.

15 They dig a deep pit to trap others, then fall into it themselves.

plan falls on their own heads.

When allowed to run its course, evil often destroys itself. Violent people
become

victims of violence and liars become victims of others' deceit. BUT in the

protect 

His followers-At other times, for reasons known only to Him, God allows evil


to continue even though innocent people are hurt. .

execute final justice although it may not be during our lifetime.

followers from this evil that plagues our country. Amen



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Worship the LORD with gladness; 
come before him with joyful songs. Psalm 100:2

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 1 O Lord, our Lord, your majestic name fills the earth! Your glory is higher than the heavens. 2 You have taught children and infants to tell of your strength, silencing your enemies and all who oppose you.
reflection: Have you noticed how easy it is for children to trust and praise God without reservations? Have you also notice that, as we grow older, many of us find it more and more difficult to do so. So what are we to do? Well what we need to do is ask God to give us a childlike faith removing any and all barriers-so that we might have a closer walk with Him. Simple yes, but oh how often we neglect to do just that, if we did it would eliminate oh so many worries.
prayer: Dear Lord remove the barriers that stand in the way that I might praise You as I should so that I might have a closer walk with You. Amen

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"He says, "Be still, and know that I am God;" Psalm 46:10

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: When I look at the night sky and see the work of your fingers - the moon and the stars you set in place4 what are people that you should think about them, mere mortals that you should care for them? 5 Yet you made them only a little lower than God and crowned them with glory and honor.
reflection: In order to respect God's Majesty, we must compare ourselves to His greatness. When we look at all creation, we often feel small by comparison. Now to feel small Is a healthy way to get back to reality, but God does not want us to dwell on our smallness. Remember this, humility means proper respect for God, not self-depreciation. The next time you question your worth as a person, remember that God considers you highly valuable. We have great worth because we bear the stamp of the Creator. Remember God considered us so valuable that He sacrificed His own Son so that the debt for our sins was paid in full. .
prayer: Dear Lord, I often wonder how You can be concerned for me when I constantly disappoint you. This is a love that I cannot begin to phantom. All I can do is thank You once again, and beg Your forgiveness. Amen.

should care for them? 

5 Yet you made them only a little lower than God and crowned them with glory
and honor.

greatness.

small 

Is a healthy way to get back to reality, but God does not want us to dwell
on our

smallness. .

constantly disappoint you. This is a love that I cannot begin to phantom.

All I can do is thank You once again, and beg Your forgiveness. Amen.



Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Ps. 7:17 I will thank the Lord because He is just;

I will sing praises to the name of the Lord Most High.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 6 You put us in charge of everything You made, giving us authority over all things.
reflection: God gave us human tremendous authority, to be in charge of the whole earth. But with great authority comes great responsibility. If we own a pet, we have the legal authority to do with it as we wish, but we also have a responsibility to feed and care for it. How have you treated God's creation? Remember we are to use our resources wisely because God holds us accountable as stewards. .
prayer: Dear Lord, Help me remember my responsibilities today so that I may be a good steward. Amen.
original_content:
HERE IS FRIDAY'S DEVO. AS I WILL BE IN ST. CLOUD



Today's Verse: Psalm 8:6 (NLT)

6 You put us in charge of everything You made, giving us authority over all
things.



Today's Thoughts:

God gave us human tremendous authority, to be in charge of the whole earth.

But with great authority comes great responsibility. If we own a pet, we
have

the legal authority to do with it as we wish, but we also have a
responsibility 

to feed and care for it.

How have you treated God's creation? Remember we are to use our resources
wisely

because God holds us accountable as stewards. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, Help me remember my responsibilities today so that I may be a
good steward. .Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I will praise you, Lord, with all my heart; I will tell of all the marvelous things you have done. 2 I will be filled with joy because of you. I will sing praises to your name, O Most High. 3 My enemies retreated; they staggered and died when you appeared.
reflection: When we express our praises to God we are showing our appreciation and understanding of His worth. It is saying thank You for each of the aspects of His divine nature. In doing so our inward attitude becomes an outward expression. When we praise God, we help ourselves by expanding our awareness of who He is. To further this awareness, in each Psalm you read, look for an attribute or characteristic of God for which you can thank Him for. .
prayer: Dear heavenly Father there are many marvelous things of which I could give you praise. Today I would just like to praise and thank You for providing the way of salvation through Your Son, or Lord Jesus Christ. Guide me in the path of righteousness. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 9:1-3 (NLT)

I will praise you, Lord, with all my heart; I will tell of all the marvelous
things you have done.

2 I will be filled with joy because of you. I will sing praises to your
name, O Most High. 
3 My enemies retreated; they staggered and died when you appeared. 

Today's Thoughts:

When we express our praises to God we are showing our appreciation and
understanding of His worth. .

It is saying thank You for each of the aspects of His divine nature. .

In doing so our inward attitude becomes an outward expression. .

When we praise God, we help ourselves by expanding our awareness of who He
is. .



To further this awareness, in each Psalm you read, look for an attribute or
characteristic 

of God for which you can thank Him for. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear heavenly Father there are many marvelous things of which I could give
you praise.

Today I would just like to praise and thank You for providing the way of
salvation 

through Your Son, or Lord Jesus Christ. Guide me in the path of
righteousness. .Amen.

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6
